<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Marketing Manager - Evernorth Care Group - Scottsdale/Phoenix

Location: Scottsdale, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Marketing, Strategy/Planning

Description:
The Senior Marketing Manager - will support the Evernorth Care Group business segment based in Scottsdale, Arizona. This role sits on the senior leadership team for the medical group providing strategic marketing support with a focus on patient acquisition and retention and in building awareness of the ENCG brand and services. The senior marketing manager will take a leadership role in developing and executing against the marketing plan, including website optimization, market conditioning, and B2C communications, aligned to the overarching business strategy. In addition, this individual will support ongoing marketing optimizations around key enterprise initiatives and local community activations. Reporting to the Managing Director, this matrix role has a dotted line reporting to the Chief Integration and Transformation Officer of Evernorth Care Group.

Key responsibilities include: developing annual marketing plans, budgets, and strategies, and tactics providing guidance to improve market penetrance, generating differentiated positioning and value propositions, managing competitor/patient/provider insights t, cultivating relationships with in-market health plan leadership, plan client employers, and brokers/field sales representatives, and oversight of the execution of all marketing plans. This role will partner with business leaders on forecasting and KPI management, and work with Evernorth Care Group functional partners and external agency partners to design and execute campaigns.

A successful candidate for this role will have experience creating and optimizing multi-channel marketing plans. Significant marketing strategy, direct-to-consumer marketing, and multi-channel marketing experience is needed. Experience working in a dynamic, evolving environment with multiple cross-functional partners will be required. Finally, experience in the healthcare/insurance industry is desired. The ideal candidate will be based Phoenix, Arizona) with expected site visits to our local healthcare centers and other business travel as needed.

Duties and Responsibilities

 Partner with senior leaders to provide the strategic direction for all marketing initiatives, specifically focused on patient acquisition, patient retention, patient engagement, and growth goals aligned to business objectives.Develop and evolve brand positioning, strengthen market conditioning, and highlight differentiation and proof points that align with corporate marketing guidance and brand platforms while considering ways to leverage the Evernorth brand in market.Develop and maintain effective marketing strategies to enhance the Evernorth Care Group NPS score and maintain a positive digital patient experience.Manage a team where all are continually learning, evolving, and encouraged to think outside the box.Consistently collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, including but not limited to local market clients (E.g. Cigna Commercial and other payors), internal agency partners and other matrix partners to foster, facilitate and deliver maximum results that are on strategy, on time, and within budget.Share emerging trends, while monitoring the external environment & competitive position of the brand.In partnership with the business, manage marketing budget, including monthly billing and accrual review. Support branding at clinical practice sites through the development of signage and placement plans (interior and exterior)Manage and optimize website design and content and leverage social media platforms to highlight Care Group sites, providers, and eventsOptimize budgetary funding impact via effective marketing tacticsAllocate and manage internal/external resources for maximum benefit.Ability to influence in a matrixed environment and present decisive recommendations.Oversee creation of sales materials and patient collateral, and leverage both traditional and modern marketing techniques.   

Reporting Relationship

 Reports directly to the Managing Director of Evernorth Marketing Health ServicesDotted line to the Chief Integration and Transformation Officer of Evernorth Care GroupLeads a total organization of 2--3 direct reports  

Ideal Candidates Will Offer

 Bachelor’s Degree; MBA or Master’s Degree a plus7-10+ years of relevant, strategic experience, including 3-5+ years of people managementExperience managing external creative agenciesExperience in developing and executing against marketing plansExperience with marketing analytic and testing methodologiesKnowledge of and experience with Adobe Analytics preferredExperience in balancing strategy within operational parametersExperience working in a fast-based, metric driven environmentAbility to work effectively in dynamic, rapidly changing, team-based environmentMust balance high-priority, long-term projects with short-term, immediate deadlinesProven ability to lead in a heavily matrixed environmentAbility to foster collaboration and value others perspectives and gain support and buy-in from senior leadershipExcellent oral and written communication skills and executive presenceExcellent attention to detailHealthcare industry experience a plusAbility to travel locally to our centers for business purposes (less than 20%) in the greater Phoenix/Scottsdale areaAbility to work onsite (60%) and remotely (40%) as this is considered a hybrid role  

 

 If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload. 

About Evernorth Health Services

 Evernorth Health Services, a division of The Cigna Group, creates pharmacy, care and benefit solutions to improve health and increase vitality. We relentlessly innovate to make the prediction, prevention and treatment of illness and disease more accessible to millions of people. Join us in driving growth and improving lives. 

Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, age, disability, sex, childbirth (including pregnancy) or related medical conditions including but not limited to lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital or familial status, genetic information, status with regard to public assistance, citizenship status or any other characteristic protected by applicable equal employment opportunity laws.

If you require reasonable accommodation in completing the online application process, please email: SeeYourself@cigna.com for support. Do not email SeeYourself@cigna.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

The Cigna Group has a tobacco-free policy and reserves the right not to hire tobacco/nicotine users in states where that is legally permissible. Can
didates in such states who use tobacco/nicotine will not be considered for employment unless they enter a qualifying smoking cessation program prior to the start of their employment. These states include: Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Idaho, Iowa, Kansas, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Nebraska, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Texas, Utah, Vermont, and Washington State.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
